definitions.body: Amon, an Egyptian god Na 3:8, Je 46:25, comp. by Greeks with Zeus (Herod.: ii. 42; Diod.:i. 13), )Ammw=n. He was originally the local deity of Thebes (= [[נאׁ]], called [[נאׁ אָמוֹן]] Na 3:8, cf. [[מִנּאׁ]] ´[[א]] Je 46:25), but subsequently became the supreme god of the Egyptian Pantheon, the successor of the sun-god Ra and so-called Amon Ra. He was the secret god, who hid himself and was difficult to find (Amon = concealment, hidden); v. Rawl.:Hist, Anc. Egypt, i. 322 Ebers Ri:HWB. (II. III. [[אָמוֹן]] v. p. 54.)
